channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Furniture and DIY waste dumped by Edbrooke Gardens Park, again!, 26th November
item.description:
Office chair, curtain poles and 4 bags of rubbish under trees on Goldney Road by Edbrooke Gardens. This is a longstanding problem site for rubbish dumping. Please can cameras be installed to deter people from dumping here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Goldney Road, Maida Vale, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boxes and packaging dumped outside Elmfield House, again!, 26th November
item.description:
Amazon boxes and packaging left on Goldney Road, outside Emfield House. Address on package: Malakeh Mouh, Flat 10, Emlfield House, Goldney Road, London. There is consistently packaging dumped outside these flats, please can the flytipping policy be enforced, particularly as there is an address on the package.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Goldney Road, Maida Vale, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights and no road works taking place, 26th November
item.description:
3 way temporary traffic lights were installed and Birchwood road closed at 7am on Monday 24 th November due to roadworks. It’s now 9am wednesday 26th November and after days of built up traffic, causing congestion, pollution and a hazard for emergency services (as you can see from picture 3) unable to drive through the traffic these lights have caused , no roadworks have taken place as yet. Utility companies shouldn’t be allowed to enforce these works if they aren’t carrying them out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: This car has been using the electric charging bay for day parking, 26th November
item.description:

item.title: Carpet collection, 26th November
item.description:
Someone has arranged a collection of a huge amount of carpet that is blocking access to our bin store. Please ensure it’s collected today as booked or the rubbish collectors won’t have access tomorrow to empty our bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fenton Close, Hackney, London
